intro: Tridactyle pentalobata, commonly known as the five-lobed tridactyle, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive five-lobed leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments, such as under the canopy of forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
